reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first time we passed through Hokitika it was pouring with rain and we didn't think much of the place. This time it was sunny and what a difference the weather makes. We stayed in a beachfront chalet and it was superb. The glow worm cave is just across the road, the beach is out the front, but it's not a swimming beach, it's a wild beach strewen with driftwood and ruggedly beautful. The chalet was quiet, as was the camping ground it's located on. Small kitchenette with everything you need. Clean, spacious, cosy and new. We even got a little note to remind us that it was daylight saving time and remember to adjust the clocks. Hokitika is the place for buying jade with lots of outlets in the main shopping town. Stock up with groceries at the local New World and you are set for dinner and breakfast. Wireless internet was reasonably priced. While at Hokitika make a trip out to the Hokitika gorge, but don't forget the spray for the sand flies. Beautiful gorge. You can loop back but the road alongside the lake is gravel part of the way and some hire car leasing arrangements don't allow driving off the bitumen.
reviews.title: Beachfront bliss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Shining Star provides "caravan park" accommodation of exceptional quality. The grounds are landscaped, next to the beach and there is a wide choice available. We stayed in one of the premium beach front chalets, a spacious and modern unit with lovely views across garden (including a few sheep!) to the sea. Clean, well maintained and the reception was helpful. Loved the menagerie!
reviews.title: Beach front chalets are a winner!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights here in a beachfront chalet which appeared to be the pick of the accommodations. A short walk across the dune and you arrive at a wild and windswept black sand beach, where you can amble for hours exploring the driftwood and pebbles washed up on the tides. It's about a 20 min walk along the beach into town - which to be honest was a little dreary. It's very much a working town, with a few gemstone and souvenir shops thrown in. Although we did have some lovely meals at a French style cafe. The rooms at the property are large spacious and up to date, very clean and always have the sound of the sea in the background. It's also a short walk to a glo worm dell and a petting zoo behind the property. Staff were pleasant and we highly recommend a trip back into the hinterland to visit the Hokitki Gorge - amazing powdery blue water. A sunset meal of fish and chips out at the point was another highlight for us.
reviews.title: Spend a bit more and enjoy the Beachfront Chalets!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't recommend Shining Star enough. This was our second visit and enjoyed it even more. The only sounds are the birds and the crashing of the Tasman sea just beyond our balcony. A little walk across the road in the evening takes you to the gloworm dell and a longer walk takes you into the delightful little town. The cabins are neat, tastefully furnished, well-equipped and modern. They are private, each with a little outside space and access to the wild beach. A must on any tour of the West Coast.
reviews.title: Absolutely love it here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 1 night in Beach Front Chalet, although not truely beach front as there is some sort of paddock between it and the beach, it was great, room large clean and had everything you needed. Nice deck which we sat on over looking the beach and sea. Natural beach which appears to go for miles. One of the best value for money places we stayed during our trip.
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night after visting the glaciers. The reception staff were lovely - we said we may possibly upgrade and she offered us the keys to a few places to see which we wanted. Decided to just opt for our first choice of a standard ensuite cabin. It was a lovely setting and the room was well equipt and clean, a little cramped with a double and single beds but it suited our needs. The closeness to the beach was great - our 2 year old loved it, he also thought the animals onsite were fantastic. Town is a short drive away and has most things you would need. Would stay here again and would recommend to families - in fact already have!
reviews.title: Lovely for children

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Try to reserve one of the chalets at the front facing the ocean. You will have an amazing shaped chalet with an A frame appearance just thirty yards to the unique Hokitika beach.
reviews.title: AMAZING in every way is this Hokitika Accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Pieces of wood from trees swept in and out of the ocean from the hinterland - some small some tiny and some HUGE! The accommodation is of a very high standard with a mezanine floor level for your bedroom. The kitchen is well equipped but in town there are great restaurants so no need to take up any fo your holiday time cooking! Don't miss this experience it is awesome! We were there for just a few times Nect time at least a week!
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Look you could even try your hadn at gold panning (be lucky!)
reviews.title: Spacious and romantic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tip pronounce the town as Hoe in the first three letters not Haw and then the locals may wonder how you know!
reviews.title: Love the beach, love the farm!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Definitely stay in one of the chalets overlooking the ocean. Loads of light streamed into the wooden chalet. It was spotlessly clean, really modern with a fabulous bathroom, very comfortable beds, well equipped kitchen and ultra modern tv and dvd equipment. Great internet connection.
reviews.title: Fabulous - A real Gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved having our dinner on the deck looking out to sea and afterwards we were able to wander along the beach. You can hear the ocean in the chalet. Sadly we only had one night here but our Aussie neighbours had been before and were staying for 5 days. They also raved about the place!!
reviews.title: Very Pleasant Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The glow worm caves are directly opposite so be sure to visit after dark. Don't forget to take a torch or mobile phone light to see your way! We didn't try the spa facilities.
reviews.title: Motorhome stay in powered site

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hokitika is a well laid out town and there is plenty to do in the vicinity, eg the gorge, shanty town, endless good walks.
reviews.title: wish we had time to stay longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Trust us, you won't be disappointed with this choice!!!!
reviews.title: Wonderful beachfront location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed in a two room chalet, and it was great to have a separate room upstairs for the kids, and the kitchen was helpful. The log-construction was charming, yet plenty warm even on a cold winter day. Great privacy, and easy access to a great beach. WiFi is available ($10 for 2 hours, which is pretty standard in NZ).
reviews.title: Great family cabin, easy beach access

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Hokitika is a nice little town. Lots of greenstone (jade) galleries, and don't miss the art-glass studio.
reviews.title: Good for cabin-style accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night in June 2011. Ok for cabin style stay. Rooms hard to keep warm, but kitchen had most things, bathroom a bit dated but clean. Location though was great, right on the beach and across the road from the glow worm dell.
reviews.title: Beach view, death defying railway crossing and llamas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The long drive from Nelson to Franz Josef needed a breaking point. We chose the Shining Star in Hokitika. The rooms/chalets (call them what you want) were very nice ( i think we had a superior one, which backed onto the beachfront). They were clean, spacious and were reasonably well equipped (fridge and corkscrew!). There was a little veranda that looked towards the sea (a good place to have your fush and chups).
reviews.title: Wonderful location, great chalet stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Reception staff were reasonably helpful, although calling Hokitika a CITY caused me much confusion and amusement.
reviews.title: Great value family destination
